note_text:
Proc: EBUS-TBNA. Sedation: Moderate.
- Stations sampled: 4R, 7, 10R.
- Result: Metastatic adenocarcinoma confirmed.
- No complications.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text: PROCEDURE: Endobronchial Ultrasound-Guided Transbronchial Needle Aspiration (EBUS-TBNA). Under moderate sedation, the EBUS bronchoscope was advanced. A systematic interrogation of the mediastinum identified FDG-avid lymphadenopathy. Stations 4R (right lower paratracheal), 7 (subcarinal), and 10R (right hilar) were sequentially sampled. Rapid on-site evaluation (ROSE) confirmed metastatic adenocarcinoma.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text:
CPT Code Justification: 31653 (EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations).
Technique: Linear EBUS scope used. Needle aspiration performed at three distinct nodal stations: 4R, 7, and 10R. All samples adequate for diagnosis.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text:

Procedure: EBUS-TBNA
1. Moderate sedation initiated.
2. Scope inserted orally.
3. Identified target nodes (4R, 7, 10R).
4. 22G needle passes x3 each station.
5. Diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma.
Plan: Oncology referral.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text: ebus procedure patient sedated moderate we checked the nodes 4r 7 and 10r they lit up on pet so we sampled them needle went in fine got the tissue confirmed cancer adeno type no bleeding really patient woke up good.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text: EBUS-TBNA under moderate sedation with sampling of FDG-avid stations 4R, 7, and 10R confirming metastatic adenocarcinoma. The procedure was tolerated well. Assessment of the airways revealed no endobronchial lesions. Rapid on-site pathology was consistent with malignancy.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text: The patient underwent an EBUS-TBNA procedure under moderate sedation to investigate avid lymph nodes. We specifically targeted stations 4R, 7, and 10R. Using the ultrasound-guided needle, we obtained samples from each station. The preliminary pathology results confirmed the presence of metastatic adenocarcinoma.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text:
Procedure: Endobronchial sonographic needle extraction.
Action: Sampled FDG-hot nodes at loci 4R, 7, and 10R. Analysis validated metastatic adenocarcinoma.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA performed on three stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports code 31653.

note_text:
Proc: Nav Bronch + Cryoablation LUL.
- ENB/REBUS used for loc.
- Target: LUL peripheral adeno.
- Cryoablation performed.
- No complications.

rationale: Bronchoscopic cryoablation of a peripheral tumor is captured by 31641.
Navigation (ENB) and radial EBUS confirmation are reported with add-on codes 31627 and 31654.

note_text: OPERATIVE REPORT: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy (ENB) combined with radial endobronchial ultrasound (REBUS) was utilized to localize a peripheral adenocarcinoma in the left upper lobe. Following confirmation of the probe position, a flexible cryoprobe was deployed. Cryoablation was executed to achieve tumor destruction. The patient tolerated the procedure without adverse events.

rationale: Bronchoscopic cryoablation of a peripheral tumor is captured by 31641.
Navigation (ENB) and radial EBUS confirmation are reported with add-on codes 31627 and 31654.

note_text:

rationale: Bronchoscopic cryoablation of a peripheral tumor is captured by 31641.
Navigation (ENB) and radial EBUS confirmation are reported with add-on codes 31627 and 31654.

6. Extubation.

rationale: Bronchoscopic cryoablation of a peripheral tumor is captured by 31641.

note_text: PROCEDURE: Ion robotic-assisted bronchoscopy. The left lower lobe mass was cannulated. Radial EBUS confirmed the target. Transbronchial biopsies were obtained for histopathology. Subsequently, three fiducial markers were deployed under fluoroscopic and robotic guidance to facilitate future stereotactic radiation therapy. (CPT 31626, 31628, 31627, 31654).

rationale: Fiducial placement (31626) is the primary code.
Robotic navigation (31627), radial EBUS (31654), and transbronchial biopsy (31628) are reported as part of the peripheral lesion management.

rationale: Fiducial placement (31626) is the primary code.

- Path: Non-necrotizing granulomas.
- Dx: Sarcoidosis.

rationale: EBUS-TBNA of four nodal stations (7, 4R, 10R, 11R) supports 31653.

note_text: PROCEDURE: EBUS-TBNA was undertaken to evaluate mediastinal and hilar adenopathy in a non-smoker. Stations 7, 4R, 10R, and 11R were sampled. Histological evaluation demonstrated non-necrotizing granulomas, consistent with a diagnosis of sarcoidosis (CPT 31653).

rationale: EBUS-TBNA of four nodal stations (7, 4R, 10R, 11R) supports 31653.

note_text:

- Guidance: Ultrasound.
- Fluid: 650mL blood-tinged.
- Complications: None.

rationale: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic thoracentesis supports 32555.

note_text: PROCEDURE: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic thoracentesis. The left hemithorax was scanned, and a pocket of fluid was identified. Under sterile conditions and local anesthesia, a needle was introduced. 650 mL of hemorrhagic fluid was drained from the patient with a known LUL mass (CPT 32555).

rationale: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic thoracentesis supports 32555.
